text:
sample from release batik 1.0 generated SVG file:
  <rect x="60" y="20" fill="none" width="-57" height="-10" stroke="black" />
If I swap it around and draw the same rectangle (x=3,y=10,w=57,h=10) I get: 
  <rect x="3" y="10" fill="none" width="57" height="10" stroke="black" />

Problem: As stated in bug 929, the width and height are lengths and should not 
be negative.  They also do not display in Adobe's SVG-Viewer.  When rendered 
with a standard Graphics2D (instead of SVGGraphics2D) it renders fine.

Possibly related bug: I get a NullPointerException when I attempt to 
SVGGraphics2D.drawString(...) after setting a clipping rectangle with a 
negative width and/or height.
creator: Leslie.Ramer@peregrine.com
vincent.hardy@sun.com
text:
This was fixed in Batik 1.1:

http://cvs.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/xml-batik/test-sources/org/apache/batik/svgge
n/NegativeLengths.java

There is now no NullPointerException on a drawString following an attempt to
drawString after setting a clip to a rect with negative width and/or height.

However, this shows another problem in Batik: the text is not clipped at all,
where it should be clipped completely. I have entered another bug for that 
after closing this one.
